top_categories.workout_context: Racing Sea Otter Classic Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Sea Otter Classic Gravel’s fort ord fire roads, coastal gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Sea Otter Classic Gravel’s former military base fire roads and coastal gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Sea Otter Classic Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
At 89 miles, Sea Otter Classic Gravel punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Sea Otter Classic Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Sea Otter Classic Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Sea Otter Classic Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Sea Otter Classic Gravel — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on former military base fire roads and coastal gravel.
Sea Otter Classic Gravel’s 8,100ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Sea Otter Classic Gravel’s former military base fire roads and coastal gravel delivers on race day.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Sea Otter Classic Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Sea Otter Classic Gravel’s 89 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Sea Otter Classic Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on former military base fire roads and coastal gravel to build confidence. Expect: fort ord fire roads, coastal gravel, military base terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and VO2max to prepare you for 89 miles of former military base fire roads and coastal gravel in Monterey, California.
